snippet: A three-judge panel ruled that non-Muslims may not use the word to refer to God, citing concerns of a threat to Islam.
abstract: Malaysian court rules that non-Muslims may not use the word 'Allah' to refer to God, latest decision in long dispute that has polarized the multicultural country; ruling is intended to protect Islam, country's official religion, from conversions.
lead_paragraph: A three-judge panel ruled that non-Muslims may not use the word to refer to God, citing concerns of a threat to Islam.

headline.main: Malaysian Court Restricts Use of ‘Allah’ to Muslims
headline.print_headline: Malaysian Court Restricts Use of ‘Allah’ to Muslims, Citing Concerns of a Threat to Islam
